name: Chaos
description: This algorithm generates chaotic CVs according to a variety of so-called 'attractors', including the well-known Lorenz equations. Each generates three CVs, named X, Y, and Z, which are available on separate outputs. You can modify the parameters of the Lorenz equation - 'Rho mod' affects 'r' (aka ''), and 'Beta mod' affects 'b' (aka ''). With the values at 0V, the parameters are the classic values as studied by Lorenz (28 and 8/3 respectively).
gui_description: The display shows a graphical representation of the outputs, projected onto the X/Y, X/Z, and Y/Z planes.

params.name: Attractor
params.description: Chooses which equations to use: Lorenz, Rossler, Aizawa, Arneodo, or Thomas.

params.name: Speed range
params.description: Sets the range of the Speed control, in quarter octaves (i.e. a change of 4 doubles or halves the speed).

params.name: Speed
params.description: Controls the speed of the simulation.

params.name: Rho mod
params.description: Modulates the Lorenz 'r' parameter.

params.name: Beta mod
params.description: Modulates the Lorenz 'b' parameter.

params.name: Reset
params.description: When this parameter is set to 1, the system is reset to the values given by the Reset X/Y/Z parameters.

params.name: Reset X
params.description: The X value to reset to.

params.name: Reset Y
params.description: The Y value to reset to.

params.name: Reset Z
params.description: The Z value to reset to.

params.name: X scale
params.description: The scale of the X output.

params.name: X offset
params.description: An offset added to the X output.

params.name: Y scale
params.description: The scale of the Y output.

params.name: Y offset
params.description: An offset added to the Y output.

params.name: Z scale
params.description: The scale of the Z output.

params.name: Z offset
params.description: An offset added to the Z output.

params.name: X output
params.description: The bus to use for the X output. 0 = None.

params.name: X output mode
params.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector.

params.name: Y output
params.description: The bus to use for the Y output. 0 = None.

params.name: Y output mode
params.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector.

params.name: Z output
params.description: The bus to use for the Z output. 0 = None.

params.name: Z output mode
params.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector.

params.name: Reset input
params.description: The bus to use for the reset input. A positive-going edge here resets the system to the values given by the Reset X/Y/Z parameters. 0 = None.
